# f5xc_log_receiver (Resource)

Creates a new Log Receiver object

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_log_receiver" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the LogReceiver. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the LogReceiver will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `site_local` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--site_local))
- `syslog` (Block, Optional) Syslog Server Configuration. Configuration for syslog server (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--syslog))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

Optional:

- `port` (Number) TCP Port Number. Exclusive with [default_https_port default_syslog_tls_port] Custom port number used for communication ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1 ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 65535
- `server_name` (String) SNI name. ServerName is passed to the server for SNI and is used in the client to check server certificates against. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostname: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
- `trusted_ca_url` (String) Server CA Certificates. Exclusive with [volterra_ca] The URL or value for trusted Server CA certificate or certificate chain Certificates in PEM format including the PEM headers. ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072 ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_log_receiver.example system/example
```
